letters.reason: This letter describes a road trip. Page 1 (7F6DD828...) starts in Mont Laurier on July 12, 55, mentioning Quebec and the St. Lawrence River. Page 2 (20FAB697...) continues the travelogue, describing steep roads, a lake in St. Simeon, and getting locked out of the car. Page 3 (C18F0088...) describes seeing a bear, Chicoutimi, and the Laurentide Park. Page 4 (0B8C252D...) continues the description of the park and a visit to 'Santa Claus Village'. The flow of the travel narrative is clear and consistent across these pages.

This letter, written by 'Dork', discusses organizing a play ('gotteskind') and other personal news. Page 1 (827C8FD5...) dated Sept 19, 55, asks for the play script via airmail. Page 2 (EA93F742...), dated Oct 10, 55, confirms the script's arrival and lists the cast. Page 3 (EED86E5E...) continues from the previous page, discussing the challenges of the play's dialect and mentioning evening classes. Page 4 (F2FEC3D0...) describes a recent wedding of Inge and Klaus, who are mentioned in the play context. Page 5 (2C59B68D...) continues from the wedding description, talks about a new apartment, and lists Christmas wishes, which fits the timeline approaching the end of the year.

This letter, dated Dec 17, 55, is a detailed account of a Christmas play ('Krippenspiel'). Page 1 (C362477B...) starts the letter, mentioning the successful performance. The following pages (0CF69970..., 9C378423..., 2202DE8A..., 14ED5AD3..., 8068D011..., 8DF74E2B...) all provide specific details about the play's scenes, costumes, actors, and rehearsals, forming a cohesive narrative. The final two pages (73543016..., A2527E89...) shift to Christmas gifts, specifically instructions for a coffee maker, and end with Christmas greetings and a signature, which is a logical conclusion to a pre-Christmas letter.

This letter begins on Dec 26, 55, after Christmas. Page 1 (986F5036...) thanks 'Mutti' for Christmas gifts, including an anorak. Page 2 (CCB5AF43...) describes Christmas Eve celebrations with friends. Page 3 (78DA7650...) discusses gifts given to others and the school system, mentioning evening school starting again on Jan 4th. Page 4 (FE3885B3...) continues the discussion of the school system and future plans, ending with a closing and signature.

This letter discusses health, nutrition, and healthcare costs in Canada. Page 1 (637BEC8E...) mentions the cold winter, poor dental health among new Canadians, and the lack of a public health insurance system ('Krankenkasse'). Page 2 (14126989...) continues this theme, noting the high cost of private insurance and medication, and then describes the Canadian diet with its emphasis on fresh vegetables and vitamins. Page 3 (A8FE6959...) continues the discussion on vitamins, fortified foods, and artificial sweeteners, and ends with a closing and signature from 'Dorle'.
This is a complete, single-page letter dated Jan 3, 1956, from 'Dorle' to 'Onkel Max'. It is a formal job application for a secretarial position. The content is self-contained.
This is a complete, single-page letter dated Aug 27, 66, addressed to 'Liebe Mutter'. It discusses secretarial salaries and a conflict with a supervisor at a hospital. The content is self-contained.
This is a complete, single-page postcard from Vancouver, dated July 31, 55. It is signed by 'Gretel' and addressed to 'Dorli und Mucki' in Toronto. The content is self-contained.
